title: Emsure: Insurance Management System
description: Emsure is a comprehensive insurance management system designed to streamline insurance operations for both agents and customers. The platform provides a user-friendly interface for policy management, claims processing, and customer relationship management. Built with modern web technologies, it offers real-time data synchronization and secure user authentication.
personal-learnings: I learned that building the Employee Insurance Tracking System taught me how modern tools (React, REST APIs, JWT, MySQL) can solve real issues like delays, fraud, and lack of transparency in health insurance. I saw how Agile practices and user feedback made the system scalable, secure, and user-focused. At the same time, I realized the limits of relying on small surveys, not testing for large-scale use, and working without deep stakeholder engagement. Going forward, I would improve by adding AI, blockchain, mobile access, and better integration tests while involving more stakeholders. Overall, the project showed me how tech can directly support social needs like fair healthcare.

challenges: Designing a flexible database schema that could accommodate different types of insurance policies
Implementing secure user authentication and role-based access control
Creating an intuitive UI for complex insurance workflows
Ensuring data consistency across multiple user sessions
Optimizing database queries for better performance with large datasets

title: Riverend: Food Ordering Platform
description: A comprehensive food ordering platform built with .NET framework and SQL Server database, enabling customers to browse menus, place orders, and track deliveries.

title: Krissakamde: Business Website
description: A professional business website developed using WordPress, featuring custom themes and content management capabilities.

title: Cafeteria Management System
description: A desktop-based cafeteria management system built with Java RMI (Remote Method Invocation) and MySQL database for managing orders, inventory, and customer transactions.
